dialogueTree.title: Barbell: "The barbell waits patiently on the..."
dialogueTree.text: The barbell waits patiently on the floor, like a dog for its master.

links.title: You: "Is this familiar because I'm a weig..."
links.text: Is this familiar because I'm a weightlifter?

links.title: Inland Empire: "No, it's not that... It's the stale..."
links.text: No, it's not that... It's the stale smell of rubber, the squeaky sound of sneakers, your bruised knee against the mat. And a whistle... then the feeling is gone.

links.title: Logic: "It's just a memory."
links.text: It's just a memory.

links.title: Endurance: "A memory from another life -- when..."
links.text: A memory from another life -- when you were young and fit.

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim, it's a trap. There are..."
links.text: "Look, Kim, it's a trap. There are no collars on the barbell."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right, the weights may fall..."
links.text: "You're right, the weights may fall off. Better not touch it then."

links.title: You: ""What kind of a bastard would just..."
links.text: "What kind of a bastard would just remove the collars? It should be a felony."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It would be a violation of EPIS sa..."
links.text: "It would be a violation of EPIS safety regulations if the gym was still operating. But it isn't. No one's supposed to come here anymore."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I don't really care abou..."
links.text: "Actually, I don't really care about safety hazards."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No one does, until they get smashe..."
links.text: "No one does, until they get smashed under the barbell."

links.title: You: "Lift the barbell."
links.text: Lift the barbell.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Conjuring up an inhuman amount of s..."
links.text: Conjuring up an inhuman amount of strength, you raise the barbell up in the air. Your biceps tremble, but you're a savage. This is a children's game!

links.title: You: ""Oh yeah.""
links.text: "Oh yeah."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "A warm wave of accomplishment washe..."
links.text: A warm wave of accomplishment washes over your head, as you drop the barbell to the floor. For a moment it feels like you're strong enough to succeed at anything you ever set your mind to.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Hey, but you're still in a ghost ho..."
links.text: Hey, but you're still in a ghost house... What if someone heard this? What if they know you're here?!

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good technique." The lieutenant no..."
links.text: "Good technique." The lieutenant nods with approval.

links.title: You: ""I'm a true champion!""
links.text: "I'm a true champion!"

links.title: You: "(Say nothing, revel in the feeling...."
links.text: (Say nothing, revel in the feeling.)

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You manage to hoist it off the grou..."
links.text: You manage to hoist it off the ground, but the barbell feels wobbly and dangerous, your hands slick with sweat. Turns out you're no beast, just an old man with bad form.

links.title: Inland Empire: "See, see! This place is cursed!"
links.text: See, see! This place is cursed!

links.title: Endurance: "Even your body has failed you. It's..."
links.text: Even your body has failed you. It's a miracle you didn't injure yourself.

links.title: Logic: "Maybe it wasn't such a good idea to..."
links.text: Maybe it wasn't such a good idea to smash through that back door...

links.title: You: ""Fuck you, you stupid barbell!""
links.text: "Fuck you, you stupid barbell!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Weightlifting was never my favouri..."
links.text: "Weightlifting was never my favourite, either." The lieutenant is obviously *handling* you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""At the station gym, I mean. I pref..."
links.text: "At the station gym, I mean. I prefer running. It clears your head..." The lieutenant steps away from the barbell, letting your recover in peace.

links.title: You: ""Seems like I'm a little out of sha..."
links.text: "Seems like I'm a little out of shape. Or maybe my palms were just slippery..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Proper weightlifting gloves would..."
links.text: "Proper weightlifting gloves would definitely afford a better grip," the lieutenant agrees.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wearing gloves would definitely ma..."
links.text: "Wearing gloves would definitely make it easier," the lieutenant agrees.

links.title: You: ""Whatever, weightlifting is for the..."
links.text: "Whatever, weightlifting is for the intellectually impaired anyway."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It was never my favourite, either...."
links.text: "It was never my favourite, either." The lieutenant is obviously handling you.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Barbell: "A barbell lies on the floor. The co..."
dialogueTree.text: A barbell lies on the floor. The colour has worn off its weight plates.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "It's 60 kg. Your triceps hum at the..."
links.text: It's 60 kg. Your triceps hum at the sight of these weights. Show the world what kind of beast it's dealing with. Lift them.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There are no collars on the barbell..."
links.text: There are no collars on the barbell. This is a safety hazard.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Why does it feel so familiar?"
links.text: Why does it feel so familiar?
